block.p: Stacey Cara Graff, the daughter of Roberta and Leland Graff of Plainview, N.Y., is to be married this evening to Mark Stephen Kaufman, a son of Roberta and Dr. Paul Kaufman of Roslyn, N.Y. Rabbi Norman Kahan will perform the ceremony at Temple Israel in Lawrence, N.Y.
The couple graduated from the University of Pennsylvania.

Stacey Cara Graff, the daughter of Roberta and Leland Graff of Plainview, N.Y., is to be married this evening to Mark Stephen Kaufman, a son of Roberta and Dr. Paul Kaufman of Roslyn, N.Y. Rabbi Norman Kahan will perform the ceremony at Temple Israel in Lawrence, N.Y.
The couple graduated from the University of Pennsylvania.

Mrs. Kaufman, 26, is a candidate for a Ph.D. in school and clinical psychology at Yeshiva University. Her father owns an accounting firm that bears his name, and her mother teaches the first grade at the Stratford Road School, both in Plainview.

Mr. Kaufman, 30, is the vice president of music and business affairs at New Line Cinema in New York. The bridegroom, who received a master's degree in film from Columbia University, is also a screenwriter. He wrote ''Toothless,'' a made-for-television movie, which is scheduled to be shown in the fall on ABC. His mother is a lawyer in Hicksville, N.Y. His father, an oral surgeon, is the chairman of the department of dentistry and maxillofacial surgery at Jamaica Hospital in Queens.
